question: What constitutes default under IBC
option1: Non-payment of debt when whole or any part or instalment of the amount of debt has become due and payable and is not repaid by the debtor or the corporate debtor.
option2: Non-payment of debt when whole or part of the payment is demanded by the financial or operational creditor.
option3: Non-payment of any amount, whether in full or in part, on demand by the creditors or concerned authorities.
option4: Any payment of the creditor that is subsisting

question: What is debt under IBC?
option1: Any amount of money that is owed or due to any party
option2: A liability or obligation in respect of a claim which is due from any person and includes a financial debt and operational debt
option3: Any liability arising in respect of money advanced by a creditor to the debtor
option4: Debts arising out of loans advanced by a financial institution
